DTU Eligibility Criteria:
Inclusion Criteria (ALL must apply):
- Alert, oriented GCS 15
- Allergic reaction not resolved with initial therapy and requires ongoing monitoring or treatment
- Stable vital signs

Exclusion Criteria (ANY may apply):
- Airway or respiratory compromise
- Stridor or significant oral symptoms or anticipated intubation
- Known or suspected angioedema
- ECG changes or symptoms suggestive of ischemic heart disease
- Unstable vital signs
- Patient on oral beta blockers requiring glucagon treatment
Discharge patient as per as per provider specific instructions: ______
Continue to assess for recurrence of hives or pruritus, oral or facial edema, SOB, wheezing, GI  symptoms or hypotension
For recurrent or worsening allergic reaction symptoms
